Signal Strength¶

class signal_strength.SignalNode(MAC_address, name, signal_strength)[source]¶

A highly optimized object to keep track of the signal strength associated with a node. It is hashable, so it can be a key in a dict or an element in a set.

MAC_address and name are immutable once the instance is created, but signal_strength can be changed

Parameters:
  • MAC_address (str) – BSSID of the access point.
  • name (str) – SSID of the access point
  • signal_strength (int) – Access point signal strength, as measured from the user’s machine.
MAC_address[source]¶

BSSID of the access point, as a string (MAC address)

Example: ‘00:20:D8:2D:2C:C1’

identifier[source]¶

Unique string identifier for the access point (independent of signal_strength)

name[source]¶

Name of the node, as a string.

Example: OLIN_WH

signal_strength.get_avg_signal_nodes(samples=3, tsleep=0.15)[source]¶

Gets the average signal strength of the nearby nodes.

Parameters:
  • samples (int) – Number of measurements to make & average
  • tsleep (float) – Number of seconds to wait between measurements (although it will take a bit longer since getCoords() takes a while to execute)
Returns:

list of SignalNode objects
signal_strength.get_avg_signal_nodes_dict(samples=3, tsleep=0.15)[source]¶

Gets the average signal strength of the nearby nodes.

Parameters:
  • samples (int) – Number of measurements to make & average
  • tsleep (float) – Number of seconds to wait between measurements (although it will take a bit longer since getCoords() takes a while to execute)
Returns:

dict of the form {MAC_AddressSTR : SignalNode}
signal_strength.get_signal_node_dict()[source]¶

Scans (or gets cached versions, on some systems) of wireless signal strengths around the computer, using platform-dependent methods. Returns a dict mapping SignalNode identifiers to SignalNodes
